intro: Maxillaria microiridifolia, commonly known as the miniature iris orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate, fragrant flowers that resemble miniature irises. The plant features long, slender pseudobulbs and linear, dark green leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue with intricate patterns and are borne on terminal racemes. Maxillaria microiridifolia thrives in warm, humid environments and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
